summary:
1. Qualified Lawyer since October 2011 (Syndic Bukavu, Uvira Extension – DR Congo) at tribunals' level.

2. Extensive experience in litigation and advocacy.

3. Passionate about dispute resolution, contracting, and negotiations, with further experience and interest in human rights and international humanitarian law.

4. Author in the field of international human rights and humanitarian law, for which the link is available here: https://www.amazon.nl/Op%C3%A9rations-militaires-conjointes-UMOJA-WETU/dp/3841665993

3. YouTube content creator, political analyst, consultant, and researcher in human rights, humanitarian law, and peace.

During my time on board, I worked for 224 hours as a volunteer, helping refugees to find internships and work opportunities and advising them accordingly. The following were among my tasks:

• Conducting online and in-person interviews with Refugees to identify their needs.
• Providing advice and support in searching for a job/internship and case management.', 'title': 'Matcher at NewBees/ Netherlands/ Volunteer', 'employment_type': 'Internship'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'CONGOLESE REFUGEE COMMUNITY IN UGANDA', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Uganda', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'CONGOLESE REFUGEE COMMUNITY IN UGANDA', 'description': 'I was in charge of administration and finances. During my term, I was awarded for advocacy of refugee rights in the Nakival refugee settlement back in December 2019 by Ngoma Festival Refugee Award. 

Before being appointed as the first Vice-president, I contributed to the redaction, and amendment of the Memorandum of the Constitution, several Memoranda of Understanding (MoU), and the organization profile. 

I established a professional workforce in the workplace, which enable the organization to attract external partners to work with it.', 'title': '1st VICE-PRESIDENT - ADMINISTRATION AND FINANCES/VOLUNTEER WORK', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 307965, 'name': 'Norwegian Refugee Council', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGdCUkJx3f1Zg/company-logo_400_400/0/1679575828402?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=NiNPqV_TCDognDirGzvVaCq0oUIS4yvCDkC1eOjFBsY', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/norwegian-refugee-council/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Kampala, Central Region, Uganda', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Norwegian Refugee Council', 'description': '• Providing group information sessions to refugees (Congolese, South Sudanese, Burundian, and Somali) and host communities on housing, land, and property rights (‘HLP’) (community outreach).

• Counselling refugees on HLP on an individual basis and supporting them with related issues such as investigations and tenancy disputes after conducting legal research in the applicable legislation.

• Raising awareness through home visits about refugee legal framework, and refugee integration in the host community.

• Providing group information sessions to refugees about the process and necessary documentation for applying for refugee status and supporting relevant applications and appeals on an individual basis.

• Participated in organizing refugee surveys about HLP and refugee status determination and analyzed qualitative and quantitative data based on the responses.

• Supporting community partners/stakeholders to advocate for policy changes affecting their community.

• Monitoring court cases and legislative developments about refugees.', 'title': 'COMMUNITY PARALEGAL - INFORMATION, COUNSELING AND LEGAL ASSISTANCE PROJECT, (ICLA) ', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'INTER AID UGANDA', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Rubaga, Central Region, Uganda', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'INTER AID UGANDA', 'description': 'Inter Aid Uganda InterAid Limited is a humanitarian national organization involved in projects geared toward the improvement of livelihoods of the disadvantaged persons both in rural and urban areas. It has consequently a wide experience in the field of developmental assistance, implementing, monitoring and evaluating health, environment, microfinance, and human rights programmes in addition to working with displaced persons, particularly refugees.

As a Community Extension Worker SGBV (Sexual Gender-Based Violence) -Peer Educator, my group focus was the Congolese Refugee Community because I was holding the position of vice president in charge of Administration and finances within. 

The following were my duties:

• Mobilizing and conducting community dialogues with refugees and the host community to raise awareness regarding SGBV (Sexual Gender-Based Violence: Rape, harassment, domestic violence, etc... ) matter;

• Organizing community outreach activities regarding SGBV, redaction, and reporting to the protection officer for further management;

• Conducting interviews with refugee victims of SGBV and making referrals for further management.', 'title': 'COMMUNITY EXTENSION WORKER – PEER EDUCATOR', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Frederic Kayabu, Don Shabani and Associates Law firm', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Uvira, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'Frederic Kayabu, Don Shabani and Associates Law firm', 'description': 'Co-Owning  the ‘Frederic Biguru Kayabu and Don Shabani and Associates Law Office, and managing 4 associates, the following were my practice areas: Active Litigation and Legal Advice Criminal law, Commercial Law, Corporate Law, Family Law and Human Rights and Humanitarian Law.', 'title': 'Corporate Lawyer', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': "ARCHE D'ALLIANCE /NGO of Defence of human rights and  promoting peace.", 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Uvira, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': "ARCHE D'ALLIANCE /NGO of Defence of human rights and  promoting peace.", 'description': "DECLIK stands for DEVELOPPER, CONFORTER LES INITIATIVES DES DEFENSEURS DES DROITS HUMAINS AUX KIVU in French. It is a project funded by the European Union to support the work of human defenders in a hostile work environment in the Easter of DR Congo.

• Focal point of Network of protection of human rights defenders, witnesses, and victims (Uvira and Fizi) in partnership with MONUSCO-BCNUDH (Bureau Conjoint des Nations Unies aux Droits de l’Homme), Front Line Defenders, Fonds d'urgence and Protection International.

• Undertake clerical tasks such as data entry, collating, emailing and maintenance of the database

• Support follow-up on cases taken up by Front Line Defenders or other specific projects relating to Human Rights Defenders as requested;

• Draft as requested, minutes, briefings, reports, and appeals;

• Providing training in conflict management and alternative dispute resolution methods to various social groups to promote civil and social peace and justice; training in human rights concepts and their violation as well as, reporting technics and advocating.

• Visiting places of detention and prisons to verify compliance with the law and the proper treatment of detainees according to Geneva Conventions, international human rights instruments, and Congolese criminal procedures; in case of possible human rights violations drafting assessment reports addressed to various partners (e.g., the International Committee of Red Cross, United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs/UNOCHA, United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the DRCongo-Penitentiary unit/MONUSCO) and public authorities.

• Monitoring, analyzing, following up, reporting, and advocating for fellow human rights defenders facing threats in Uvira and Fizi, assessing the genuineness of their case before their relocation.

• Carry out administrative tasks as requested;

• Hired trainer in human rights with external partners such as ZOA,  AFPDE, etc...", 'title': 'HEAD OF PROJECT DECLIK AND JUDICIARY PROGRAMMES', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'INSTITUT KALUNDU UVIRA/ HIGH SCHOOL', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Uvira, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'company': 'INSTITUT KALUNDU UVIRA/ HIGH SCHOOL', 'description': 'As a teacher, I had the responsibility to deliver the following courses to the high school students: General Introduction to Law, Civil Law, and Criminal Law.', 'title': 'LAW TEACHER ', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 6884, 'name': 'Oxfam', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQGxggEAfTho3A/company-logo_400_400/0/1551261387275?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=5fDpdo6yPN5WZocV6__OGDp3SPxCUSS9Zv0_f5Tv0ic', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/oxfam/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Uvira, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'company': 'Oxfam', 'description': '• Collecting public health data through surveys and interviews; 

 • Reporting to the Head of the Project for analysis; and

 • Contributing to the publication of the final report.', 'title': 'PROJECT AGENT DATA COLLECTION', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}]
